name: Price Increase - Expenditure Increase - Quantity Decrease
name_hi: कीमत वृद्धि - खर्च वृद्धि - मात्रा कमी

signature.embedding_text: If price of an item increases by X percent and expenditure increases by Y percent, by what percentage should quantity be decreased

trick.name: Ratio Method

steps.action: Consumption = (100 + Increase in Price) / (100 + Increase in Expenditure)
steps.example: X% price increase, Y% expenditure increase → Consumption = (100 + X) / (100 + Y)
steps.example_hi: X% कीमत वृद्धि, Y% खर्च वृद्धि → उपभोग = (100 + X) / (100 + Y)

steps.example: X% price increase, Y% expenditure increase → Reduction = (X - Y) / X
steps.example_hi: X% कीमत वृद्धि, Y% खर्च वृद्धि → कमी = (X - Y) / X

steps.example: X% price increase, Y% expenditure increase → Percentage = ((X - Y) / X) * 100
steps.example_hi: X% कीमत वृद्धि, Y% खर्च वृद्धि → प्रतिशत = ((X - Y) / X) * 100

trick.memory_hook: Price zyada badh gayi, expenditure kam badhi, toh quantity kam karni padegi

steps.action: Find difference between price increase and expenditure increase
steps.action_hi: कीमत वृद्धि और खर्च वृद्धि का अंतर निकालो

steps.action: Divide by (100 + price increase) and multiply by 100
steps.action_hi: (100 + कीमत वृद्धि) से भाग दो और 100 से गुणा करो

common_mistakes.mistake: Direct subtraction assume kar lete hain
common_mistakes.wrong: 19% price increase, 12% expenditure increase → 19% - 12% = 7% quantity decrease
common_mistakes.why: Base change hota hai, isliye direct subtraction galat hota hai

common_mistakes.mistake: Expenditure constant assume kar lete hain
common_mistakes.right: Expenditure bhi badh rahi hai, isliye formula alag hai
common_mistakes.why: Yeh pattern expenditure increase handle karta hai, constant nahi

deep.explanation:
Concept: Expenditure = Price × Quantity.

Agar price X% badh gayi (new price = 100+X) aur expenditure Y% badh gayi (new expenditure = 100+Y), toh:
New Quantity = New Expenditure / New Price = (100+Y)/(100+X)

Example: 19% price increase, 12% expenditure increase
New Quantity = 112/119 ≈ 0.9412
Reduction = 1 - 0.9412 = 0.0588 = 5.88% ≈ 6%

Direct Formula: (X-Y)/(100+X) × 100

Yaad rakho:
• Dono (price aur expenditure) badh rahe hain
• Quantity kam karni padegi kyunki price zyada badh gayi
• Formula: (X-Y)/(100+X) × 100

shortcut.explanation:
Quick trick:
1. Price increase = X%, Expenditure increase = Y%
2. New Quantity = (100+Y)/(100+X)
3. Reduction = 1 - New Quantity = (X-Y)/(100+X) × 100

Example: 19% price, 12% expenditure
New Quantity = 112/119 ≈ 0.9412
Reduction ≈ 5.88% ≈ 6%

instant.explanation: Price X% badhi, expenditure Y% badhi → Quantity = (100+X)/(100+Y), Reduction = (100 + X)/(100+Y) × 100
